text:
Jean-Louis Pierre Tauran (; 5 April 1943 – 5 July 2018) was a French cardinal of the Catholic Church. At his death he had been president of the Pontifical Council for Interreligious Dialogue since 2007.
He was made a cardinal in 2003 and was the Cardinal Protodeacon from 2011 to 2014. He was the Camerlengo of the Holy Roman Church since 20 December 2014 until his death.
Tauran died on 5 July 2018 from complications of Parkinson's disease in Hartford, Connecticut at the age of 75.

annotations.surface_form: Camerlengo of the Holy Roman Church
